candidates.title: refactor: swap the hyper client for reqwest
candidates.body:
Closes #244 

### Changes
* Swap the hyper client for reqwest when using `UrlStorage` in order to support redirects. Ported over from [here](https://github.com/umccr/htsget-rs/commit/df675cd2ce68335bbd1eb87591edccc0c89d3527), with some tidying.
* Update config docs to add an example of generating TLS certificates using OpenSSL.
* Update dependencies/MSRV.
* Remove unused feature flag in htsget-test.

candidates.title: test: concatenate byte range responses
candidates.body:
### Changes
* Improves all byte range tests in search to concatenate responses and read records using noodles.
    * Add byte range `Concat` struct in htsget-test to accomplish this.
* Simplifies htsget-test feature flags by combining `server-tests`, `cors-tests` and http-tests` into one `http` flag.
* Add more `referenceName` only tests for CRAM and BAM.

candidates.title: build(deps): update noodles to 0.65
candidates.body:
### Changes
* Updates noodles and removes the lenient read group `PL` parsing because noodles now allows this by default: https://github.com/zaeleus/noodles/issues/111#issuecomment-1910630432

candidates.title: build: update noodles and other dependencies
candidates.body:
### Changes
* Update noodles to 0.60 and other small dependency changes.
* Fix clippy warnings.

noodles 0.60 has some changes that are useful for the crypt4gh branch and I didn't want this to get too out of sync. I'm leaving out changes related to `http` 1.0, e.g. `hyper` 1.0, `tower` 0.5, `aws` 1.0, etc, because these are recent and quite large, so some of our other dependencies haven't introduced them yet.

This is mostly merging some old changes from the htsget-elsa branch.
### Changes from the Elsa branch
* Separate config parsing into a more generalized parser construct.
* Refactor lambda service functions so that they are more usable as dependencies.
* Add aws-mocks into htsget-test.

### New changes
* Update dependencies, including rustls 0.20 -> 0.21.
* Add pre-commit hooks (most of the changes at the start are just style changes from pre-commit).
* ~Attempt to move htsget-test to a dev-dependency - this might break deploy, but I can revert if needed.~

candidates.body:
Bumps [rustls-webpki](https://github.com/rustls/webpki) from 0.101.1 to 0.101.4.
Release notes

Sourced from rustls-webpki's releases.

v/0.101.4

Release notes

  • certificate path building and verification is now capped at 100 signature validation operations to avoid the risk of CPU usage denial-of-service attack when validating crafted certificate chains producing quadratic runtime. This risk affected both clients, as well as servers that verified client certificates.

What's Changed

  • v0.101.4 prep by @​cpu in rustls/webpki#153

Full Changelog: https://github.com/rustls/webpki/compare/v/0.101.3...v/0.101.4

v/0.101.3

Release Notes

  • TlsServerTrustAnchors, TlsClientTrustAnchors, verify_is_valid_tls_server_cert and verify_is_valid_tls_client_cert deprecation notes improved.

What's Changed

  • trust_anchor/end_entity: rework deprecation notes by @​cpu in rustls/webpki#149
  • 0.101.3 release prep by @​cpu in rustls/webpki#149

Full Changelog: https://github.com/rustls/webpki/compare/v/0.101.2...v/0.101.3

v/0.101.2

Release notes

  • MSRV increased to Rust 1.60.
  • Correct bug in CRL processing where certificates with certain forms of serial number were not revocable.
  • Added API for verifying certificate chain with a custom EKU, thanks to @​sietseringers.
  • TlsServerTrustAnchors, TlsClientTrustAnchors, verify_is_valid_tls_server_cert and verify_is_valid_tls_client_cert are deprecated: use verify_for_usage with KeyUsage::server_auth() or KeyUsage::client_auth() instead.

What's Changed

  • v0.101.1 release prep by @​cpu in rustls/webpki#114
  • ci: iterate on cross CI task. by @​cpu in rustls/webpki#115
  • benches: CRL parsing/searching benchmarks. by @​cpu in rustls/webpki#108
  • cargo: remove TODO about non-default alloc. by @​cpu in rustls/webpki#117
  • tests: add BetterTLS path building test suite. by @​cpu in rustls/webpki#116
  • project: increase MSRV, 1.57 -> 1.60 by @​cpu in rustls/webpki#120
  • ci: match Rustls style, add cargo-semver-checks, dependabot by @​cpu in rustls/webpki#118
  • docs: add attributes indicating req'd features. by @​cpu in rustls/webpki#123
  • clippy fixes, base64 dev-dep 0.13 -> 0.21. by @​cpu in rustls/webpki#126
  • crl/signed_data: add Debug and Clone as sensible. by @​cpu in rustls/webpki#129
  • Add verification function with custom EKU by @​sietseringers in rustls/webpki#119
  • Don't canonicalise serial numbers in CRL entries by @​ctz in rustls/webpki#132
  • Turn free-standing construction functions into associated methods by @​djc in rustls/webpki#131
  • build(deps): bump cryptography from 41.0.0 to 41.0.2 by @​dependabot in rustls/webpki#135
  • RFC: change high-level API to make key usage explicit by @​djc in rustls/webpki#133
  • Prepare release 0.101.2 by @​ctz in rustls/webpki#136

New Contributors

... (truncated)

Commits
  • d7f6aa4 Cargo: version 0.101.3 -> 0.101.4
  • dcad240 verify_cert: enforce maximum number of signatures.
  • 989ef02 Cargo: version 0.101.2 -> 0.101.3
  • 1f2a8a2 trust_anchor/end_entity: rework deprecation notes.
  • bef457f Move to using github releases
  • 8f19a0c Bump cargo version
  • 875fcef Unify high-level API to make key usage explicit
  • ee95916 Introduce more restricted public key usage API
  • 3814c03 tests: simplify compile guards in custom_ekus module
  • 1191c98 Move check_key_usage() into KeyUsageMode impl
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

candidates.title: refactor: TLS config
candidates.body:
### Changes
* Refactors TLS config into common options.
    * Add support for RSA, PKCS8, and SEC1 encoded EC keys, not just PKCS8.
    * Lift server and client rustls config construction into the `htsget-config` deserialization. This ensures that the the rustls config structs are not constructed more than necessary, as this can be expensive.
* Allow setting client authentication and non-native root certificates for the URL storage client.

candidates.title: feat: URL storage
candidates.body:
Closes #165.

This PR implements an additional storage backend called `UrlStorage`, which can fetch data from HTTP URLs. With `UrlStorage`, when htsget-rs receives a query, it will fetch data for the request from a HTTP URL, forwarding any headers received in the query. To implement this, a new feature flag is included called `url-storage`.

### Changes
* Add `UrlStorage` as a storage backend for HTTP URLs.
    * Can be configured by setting a `url` in the config.
    * `scheme` and `forward_headers` in the config affects the returned ticket responses, and is optional.
* Refactor and simplify some logic in htsget-config and htsget-http.
    * Include stronger type parsing for htsget-config.
    * Remove repeated logic in htsget-http.
* Remove `s3-storage` as the default feature flag, and require this to be set manually.
* Pass request and header information with `Query` struct, so that it can be used by `htsget-search`.
* Format parsing is now case-insensitive in `htsget-http`.
* The `headers` field in a htsget ticket can now include multiple headers with the same key.
    * When multiple headers with the same key are present, the values are serialized as a comma-separated list.
* Rename `AwsS3Storage` to `S3Storage` to match htsget-config.
* Additional tests for `UrlStorage` and other features. 

### Bug fixes
* `htsget-http` now returns `InvalidInput` when query parameters are present for POST requests, like the protocol suggests.
* Fix an issue with `LocalStorage` on windows returning incorrect URL path segments, i.e. they contained `\` instead of `/`.

candidates.title: docs(config): add documentation for endpoint when using S3 storage
candidates.body:
### Changes
* A small doc update which includes a row for the endpoint option when configuring `S3Storage`.

candidates.title: feat: add TLS to actix server
candidates.body:
* Add TLS to `htsget-actix`.
    * Certificates can be specified similar to TLS for the data server.
* Add a few additional tests and some small code refactoring.

### Update
* Fix incorrect help and version context when running htsget-rs. htsget-actix was showing `htsget-config <version>` instead of `htsget-actix <version>`, which is now fixed.
* Add the ability to set formatting styles. This improves log readability when using the `Pretty` style.

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
Bumps [h2](https://github.com/hyperium/h2) from 0.3.16 to 0.3.18.
Release notes

Sourced from h2's releases.

v0.3.18

What's Changed

  • fix: pending-accept remotely-reset streams pattern was checking is_local by @​seanmonstar in hyperium/h2#676

v0.3.17

What's Changed

  • Add Error::is_library() method to check if the originated inside h2.
  • Add max_pending_accept_reset_streams(usize) option to client and server builders.
  • Fix theoretical memory growth when receiving too many HEADERS and then RST_STREAM frames faster than an application can accept them off the queue. (CVE-2023-26964)
Changelog

Sourced from h2's changelog.

0.3.18 (April 17, 2023)

  • Fix panic because of opposite check in is_remote_local().

0.3.17 (April 13, 2023)

  • Add Error::is_library() method to check if the originated inside h2.
  • Add max_pending_accept_reset_streams(usize) option to client and server builders.
  • Fix theoretical memory growth when receiving too many HEADERS and then RST_STREAM frames faster than an application can accept them off the queue. (CVE-2023-26964)

candidates.title: feat: additional features to make configuration simpler
candidates.body:
This PR is mostly a reorganization and refactor of code, however there are some new features.

### Changes
* The storage type can now be automatically deduced:
    * For local storage, it can be determined from the data.
    * For s3 storage, the bucket is determined from the first capture group in the regex.
        * This makes it possible to specify a regex such as `'^(?P<bucket>.*)/(?P<key>.*)$'` in order to use the first component of the id as the bucket.
 * Storage can still be manually configured. The `type` parameter is removed, and the configuration of storage is now untagged.
 * `HtsGetFromStorage` and `Search` is much simpler on the `htsget-search` side - most of the storage resolution now happens in `htsget-config`.
 * Renamed `HttpTicketFormatter` and removed the `UrlFormatter` implementation on it, as this concept is represented by the `htsget-config` `LocalStorage`.
 * Moved htsget types from `htsget-search` to `htsget-config`. Most of these should be removed when #89 is addressed.
 * Additional tests, and more comprehensive server tests which involve multiple resolvers.
 * Fix `serve_at` field not being used when configuring the local data server.

candidates.title: refactor!: refactor tests to avoid a circular dependency with htsget-search and htsget-http
candidates.body:
Closes #158 

This PR refactors `htsget-tests` to avoid a circular dependency with `htsget-search` and `htsget-http`.

### Implementation
* Use generic types in `http-tests` to avoid using the structs in `htsget-search` and `htsget-http`.
* Specify expected responses using `serde_json` [`Value`](https://docs.rs/serde_json/latest/serde_json/value/enum.Value.html). This also probably makes the tests more robust as they no longer dependent on the implementation of the `htsget-http` structs.
* Move `CertificateKeyPair` to config to avoid repeating the logic in `htsget-tests` and simplifying logic in `htsget-search`. This is a breaking change as it removes the `TryFrom<DataServerConfig> for HttpTicketFormatter` implementation.

candidates.title: Set MSRV on all workspace crates

candidates.title: More flexible config
candidates.body:
Closes #102

Apologies for the very large PR, there is a bunch of changes here.

### Changes
* Config is now much more flexible, and can configure from environment variables and a TOML config file.
    * Envy is swapped out for [figment](https://github.com/SergioBenitez/Figment), which is a hierarchical system for config.
    * Config files are read using a command line option (--config) or from an environment variable.
    * When no command line options are passed, this results in a default configuration with the same behaviour as before this PR.
    * Environment variables override config files.
* Add multiple bucket support.
* Add additional CORS features, like allow origins, methods, headers, and expose headers.
* Multiple `RegexResolvers` are allowed, which can be configured using an array, where the first matching resolver is the one used for the query ID mapping.
    * Each resolver can use local storage, or AWS S3 storage.
* The resolvers also take into account the query parameters. I.e. It is possible to specify that a given resolver only resolves an ID if the format is `Bam`, for example. 
* The local storage data server can be enabled/disabled using a flag in the config file.
* Re-done documentation changes for config.
* Additional tests for new behaviour.
* Various small refactors and re-organisation of code.
* A `--print-default-config` flag can be passed as a command line arg to print the default TOML config to stdout.

#### Issues
There are still some issues that can be addressed in other PRs.
* No support for different file endings yet - i.e. BAM files always must end in `.bam`, issue #127.
* This does increase the complexity of the configuration, however I've attempted to make it as opt-in as possible. Most of the same environment variables are available. The most significant increase in complexity is in the `[[resolvers]]` array of tables, however this can still be set from an environment variable, and the additional features are not required. The defaults should be the same when running htsget-rs with no configuration. 

This PR and branch is also an experiment on using somewhat more [conventional commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/) to see how we feel about it. I haven't used many of the standard types such as `feat` or `bug`, but I have added custom types that mostly describe the scope of the change.

Also happy to revert this and squash it as one if we think it's better.

candidates.title: Add CORS support to htsget-rs
candidates.body:
This PR implements CORS for all parts of htsget-rs.

Changes:
* CORS is implemented with an allowed origin, and allowed credentials for:
    * htsget-http-actix.
    * htsget-http-lambda.
    * htsget-search `LocalStorage` data server.
* CORS mirrors `Origin` and headers in `Access-Control-Allow-Origin` and `Access-Control-Request-Headers`.
* Restructure htsget-test-utils to allow testing CORS.
* Reorganise config for CORS.
* Set of tests that ensure CORS works properly.

This change was a little bit challenging to test because the CORS middleware layers sit close to the main.rs function code, so tests are more similar to integration-style tests.

Still to do:
* Allow setting multiple origins. This will be enabled when the config crate is refactored to allow config files, as `Vec` is not as well supported in envy.

candidates.title: Update Documentation
candidates.body:
This PR changes documentation so that is it up to date with the code. Closes #110.

Looking for some feedback:
* Especially in `CONTRIBUTING.md` as that's new. 
* Also, not sure about including a splash/logo. Could be GA4GH splash, or something more UMCCR specifc?
* Also, should consider licensing for htsget. I couldn't see any licensing information for htsget documents, so maybe we shouldn't include the diagram?
* Add a `SECURITY.md`?

Changes:
* Change documentation to reflect recent code changes.
* Add READMEs for all crates.
* Add CONTRIBUTING guidelines.
* Refactor some config options to match documentation, using language from the htsget protocol.

candidates.body:

candidates.title: Tracing and buffered reads
candidates.body:
The following PR introduces changes related to logging and tracing.
Changes:
* Add various tracing logs and tracing instrument calls to help with debugging.
* Fixes issue with reading files, where an un-buffered reader was resulting in inefficiency due to many sys-calls. All read calls now use buffered reads.

candidates.title: Improve descriptiveness of errors
candidates.body:
Closes #112 

Changes:
* Improve errors so that they are more informative, propagating information from their cause to the http responses.
* Avoid reading indices unless it is necessary.

candidates.title: Responses can contain different classes
candidates.body:
Fixes #108 

Previously JSON response tickets only returned the same class. This PR changes that so that responses can contain different classes.

Changes:
* JSON responses can contain different classes. If a byte ranges is only part of one class, then the response contains that class. If a byte range contains a mix of classes, then all tickets in the JSON response do not contain a class.
* Adds class merging functionality in `BytesPosition` and `DataBlock`.
* Removes `json_response.rs` in htsget-http-core, because the logic is almost entirely implemented by the htsget-search `htsget` module structs.
* Fixes tests related to response classes.
* Adds a few tests for class merging and new functionality.

candidates.title: Fix unneseccary storage queries
candidates.body:
Closes #105 

The following PR removes all unnecessary requests to files being queried. Previously, `Search` would re-read queried files, which would result in many unnecessary s3 get requests when using `AwsS3Storage`. To fix this, [GZ formatted indicies](http://www.htslib.org/doc/bgzip.html#GZI_FORMAT) are introduced for binning index files. Now, `Search` only reads the file's header, its index, and optionally its GZ index. When the GZ index is not available, `Search` resorts to using only the file's regular index. This results in more coarse-grained byte ranges, however responses are still valid.

Changes:
* Update some docs and README.
* Refactor `Search` to not re-request the same file multiple times.
* Introduce optional GZI for binning indices, to allow for more fine-grained byte ranges.
* Add test when GZI is missing.
* Conversion of `Query` start and end ranges, to noodle's `Interval` is more clear in the type system.
* Few bug fixes, such as `CramSearch` not checking if the last record matches the requested range.
* Refactor of certain parts of `Search` and the formats that implement it.
* Bump some dependencies.

Issue #105 describes the problem as being related to `AsyncSeek`, however, implementing `AsyncSeek` would not help with reducing requests, as `Search` would re-request the same file multiple times, and eventually read it all into memory anyway.

candidates.title: Ticket server runs without TLS by default.
candidates.body:
Closes #93 

The following pull request allows the ticket server to run without TLS by default. This is a more intuitive solution which works out of the box, and doesn't require to user to provide certificates. A TLS-enabled ticket server can still be used by providing PEM formatted X.509 certificates.

Changes:
* The ticket server can be run without TLS by not providing certificates.
* Various code-style changes, and documentation improvements.
* Renaming various functions and structs to better indicate their purpose.
* GC info field in sample1-bcbio-cancer.vcf.gz has a Float type rather than an Integer type, allowing newer versions of noodles, with stricter type checking, to read it.
* Tests now run independently of each other, and use dynamic port allocation to spawn server instances.
* Fetch htsget-http-actix and htsget-http-lambda response tickets, and merge them to check proper functionality.
* Add additional tests targetting both a TLS and non-TLS enabled ticket server.
* Use a non-TLS ticket server for the htsget-http-actix server benchmarks, as this is a fairer comparison to the htsget-refserver, which also doesn't use TLS.

candidates.body:
Fixes #85

The following PR fixes out of order urls in response tickets, which were caused by using `FuturesUnordered`, instead of `FuturesOrdered`.

Changes:
* Change `FuturesUnordered` to `FuturesOrdered`.
* Bump noodles to version 0.24.

chosen_pr.title: refactor: swap the hyper client for reqwest
chosen_pr.body:
Closes #244 

### Changes
* Swap the hyper client for reqwest when using `UrlStorage` in order to support redirects. Ported over from [here](https://github.com/umccr/htsget-rs/commit/df675cd2ce68335bbd1eb87591edccc0c89d3527), with some tidying.
* Update config docs to add an example of generating TLS certificates using OpenSSL.
* Update dependencies/MSRV.
* Remove unused feature flag in htsget-test.
